==Events==
* [[421]] &ndash; [[Constantius III]] becomes co-[[Emperor]] of the [[Western Roman Empire]].
*[[1238]] &ndash; The [[Mongol Empire|Mongols]] burn the [[Russia]]n city of [[Vladimir]].
*[[1250]] &ndash; [[Seventh Crusade]]: Crusaders engage [[Ayyubid dynasty|Ayyubid]] forces in the [[Battle of Al Mansurah]].
*[[1347]] &ndash; The [[Byzantine civil war of 1341–1347]] ends with a power-sharing agreement between [[John VI Kantakouzenos]] and [[John V Palaiologos]].
*[[1575]] &ndash; [[Universiteit Leiden]] is founded, and given the motto ''Praesidium Libertatis''.
*[[1587]] &ndash; [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], is executed on suspicion of having been involved in the [[Babington Plot]] to murder her cousin, [[Elizabeth I of England|Queen Elizabeth I]].
*[[1601]] &ndash; [[Robert Devereux, 2nd Earl of Essex]], rebels against Queen Elizabeth I &ndash; the revolt is quickly crushed.
*[[1693]] &ndash; The [[College of William and Mary]] in [[Williamsburg, Virginia]] is granted a charter by [[William III of England|King William III]] and [[Mary II of England|Queen Mary II]].
*[[1726]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Privy Council]] is established in Russia.
*[[1807]] &ndash; [[Battle of Eylau]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]] defeats [[Russia]]ns under [[General]] [[Levin August, Count von Bennigsen|Bennigsen]].
*[[1817]] &ndash; [[Juan Gregorio de las Heras|Las Heras]] [[Crossing of the Andes|crosses the Andes]] with an army to join [[José de San Martín|San Martín]] and liberate [[Chile]] from Spain.
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Richard Mentor Johnson|Richard Johnson]] becomes the first [[Vice President of the United States]] chosen by the [[United States Senate]].
*[[1855]] &ndash; The [[Devil's Footprints]] mysteriously appear in southern [[Devon]].
*[[1856]] &ndash; [[Barbu Dimitrie Ştirbei]] abolishes slavery in [[Wallachia]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; In the [[United States]], [[Delaware]] voters reject the [[Thirteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution]], and vote to continue the practice of slavery. (Delaware finally ratifies the amendment on February 12, 1901.)
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Sandford Fleming]] first proposes adoption of [[Universal Standard Time]] at a meeting of the [[Royal Canadian Institute]].
*  1879   &ndash; The [[England cricket team]] led by [[George Harris, 4th Baron Harris|Lord Harris]] is [[Sydney Riot of 1879|attacked during a riot during a match]] in [[Sydney]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; The first government-approved [[Japanese in Hawaii|Japanese immigrants]] arrived in [[Hawaii]].
*[[1887]] &ndash; The [[Dawes Act]] authorizes the [[President of the United States]] to survey [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] tribal land and divide it into individual allotments.
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Battle of Port Arthur]]: A surprise [[torpedo]] attack by the [[Japan]]ese at [[Lushun|Port Arthur]], [[China]] starts the [[Russo-Japanese War]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Boy Scouts of America]] is incorporated by [[William D. Boyce]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[D.W. Griffith]]'s controversial film ''[[The Birth of a Nation]]'' premieres in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Warren G. Harding]] introduces the first [[radio]] in the [[White House]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Capital punishment]]: The first state execution in the [[United States]] by [[gas chamber]] takes place in [[Nevada]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Empire of Japan|Japan]] [[Battle of Singapore|invades]] [[Singapore]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: The [[United Kingdom]] and [[Canada]] commence [[Operation Veritable]] to occupy the west bank of the [[Rhine]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The first portion of the [[Revised Standard Version]] of the [[Bible]], the first serious challenge to the popularity of the [[Authorized King James Version]], is published.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The formal creation of the [[Korean People's Army]] of [[North Korea]] is announced.
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Cardinal Mindszenty]] of [[Hungary]] is sentenced for [[treason]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; The [[Stasi]], the [[secret police]] of [[East Germany]], is established.
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Elizabeth II]] is proclaimed [[Queen regnant|Queen]] of the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; The Government of [[Sindh]], Pakistan, abolishes the [[Feudalism in Pakistan|Jagirdari system]] in the province. One million [[acre]]s (4000&nbsp;km<sup>2</sup>) of land thus acquired is to be distributed among the landless [[peasant]]s.
*[[1960]] &ndash; Queen Elizabeth II of the [[United Kingdom]] issues an [[Order-in-Council]], stating that she and her family would be known as the [[House of Windsor]], and that her descendants will take the name "[[Mountbatten-Windsor]]".
*  1960   &ndash; The first eight brass star plaques are installed in the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Paris massacre of 1961#8 February 1962 Charonne massacre|Charonne massacre]]. Nine trade unionists are killed by French police at the instigation of [[Nazi]] collaborator [[Maurice Papon]], then chief of the Paris [[Prefecture of Police]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; Travel, financial and commercial transactions by [[United States]] citizens to [[Cuba]] are made illegal by the [[John F. Kennedy]] administration.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The First full Color Television program in the World, publicly advertised, is broadcast in [[Mexico City]] by XHGC-TV, Channel 5, due to technical breakthrough advances made by Mexican Engineer [[Guillermo Gonzalez Camarena]].
*  1963   &ndash; The regime of [[Prime Minister of Iraq]], Brigadier General [[Abdul-Karim Qassem]] is [[February 1963 Iraqi coup d'état|overthrown]] by the [[Ba'ath Party]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Eastern Air Lines Flight 663]] crashes into the [[Atlantic Ocean]] and explodes, killing everyone aboard.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[American civil rights movement]]: The [[Orangeburg massacre]]: An attack on black students from [[South Carolina State University]] who are protesting [[racial segregation]] at the town's only bowling alley, leaves three or four dead in [[Orangeburg, South Carolina]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Allende meteorite]] falls near Pueblito de Allende, [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]], [[Mexico]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[NASDAQ]] [[stock market index]] opens for the first time.
*  1971   &ndash; [[ARVN|South Vietnamese ground troops]] [[Operation Lam Son 719|launch an incursion]] into [[Laos]] to try to cut off the [[Ho Chi Minh trail]] and stop [[People's Army of Vietnam|communist infiltration]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; After 84 days in [[outer space|space]], the crew of [[Skylab 4]], the last crew to visit [[United States|American]] [[space station]] [[Skylab]], returns to [[Earth]].
*  1974   &ndash; Military [[coup]] in [[Burkina Faso|Upper Volta]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; Proceedings of the [[United States Senate]] are broadcast on [[radio]] for the first time.
*[[1981]] &ndash; Twenty-one [[association football]] spectators are [[Karaiskakis Stadium disaster|trampled to death]] at [[Karaiskakis Stadium]] in Neo [[Faliro]], [[Greece]], after a football match between [[Olympiacos F.C.]] and [[AEK Athens FC]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[Melbourne dust storm]] hits [[Australia]]'s second largest city.  The result of the worst drought on record and a day of severe weather conditions, a {{convert|320|m|ft}} deep dust cloud envelops the city, turning day to night.
*[[1986]] &ndash; '''The Hinton train collision:''' 23 people are killed when a VIA Rail passenger train collides with a 118-car Canadian National freight train near the town of Hinton, Alberta, west of Edmonton. It is the worst rail accident in Canada until the Lac-Mégantic, Quebec derailment in 2013 which killed forty-seven people.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[General Motors Corporation|General Motors]] sues [[NBC]] after ''[[Dateline NBC]]'' allegedly rigs two crashes intended to demonstrate that some GM pickups can easily catch fire if hit in certain places. NBC settles the lawsuit the next day.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] passes the [[Communications Decency Act]].
*  1996   &ndash; The massive Internet collaboration "[[24 Hours in Cyberspace]]" takes place.
*[[2010]] &ndash; A freak storm in the [[Hindukush]] mountains of [[Afghanistan]] triggers a series of at least [[2010 Salang avalanches|36 avalanches]], burying over two miles of road, killing at least 172 people and trapping over 2,000 travelers.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[February 2013 nor'easter|A blizzard]] disrupts transportation and leaves hundreds of thousands of people without electricity in the Northeastern [[United States]] and parts of [[Canada]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; A [[2014 Medina hotel fire|hotel fire]] in [[Medina, Saudi Arabia]] kills 15 [[Egypt]]ian pilgrims with 130 also injured.
